Es una jugabilidad igual que todos los juegos de Valve con GoldSrc y es muy bueno.]
Recomendado 98%

The obvious comparison here is TF2, and for me it held up surprisingly well. TFC is definitely more fast-paced, although fights tend to be more intense and last longer as classes generally move faster and are harder to kill. Combat feels like a cross between Quake and TF2, which is what you'd expect. 

Servers do tend to have few players online, but my experience with the few servers I've been on have been pleasant. Unlike some others, I didn't face any problems with the community.

TL;DR: Try Team Fortress 2 first if you haven't. For seasoned TF2 players, TFC can provide a nice change of pace.
Definitely not as good as its newer brother but still holds up!!

this is like a unity version of team fortress 2 except really good and i honestly love it so much, heavy is actually a lot better, pyro is very different from what he is in tf2, meant to annoy the enemy team, and thus basically nobody plays him.

i have 15 hours on team fortress 2 and only 31 minutes on team fortress classic as of the time of me writing this, and i'm better at team fortress classic. that valve bundle was the best thing to ever happen to me.

the entire paragraph above is outdated although it probably still stands idk.

i like how each of the classes have a more defined job, the scout being only for objectives and thus low armor, low dp and low health.

pyro being for disrupting the enemy team so medium armor and health, low dp but damaging and blinding status effect.

there's a lot more examples i suppose.

i've seen so many battle engies, just hyper-aggressive engineers, soldier and heavy is pretty widespread though. friendlies are extinct, the models are cooler, pyro is nerfed, sniper isn't that bad for some reason and it's overall a pretty nice experience.

Though a bit confusing at first, I find it a quite enjoyable game. If you play for at least an hour you can identify most classes just by looking at them. Gameplay is still pretty fun despite grenades. There's been few times I've been stomped by "Veterans" unlike most people's "Experiences". It's a great game to just chill and take a break from games that require a lot of strategy. Good, fun old game. 8/10

[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Team Fortress Classic is a game developed and published by Valve, the classic FPS shooter

The game offers some nice graphics, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

Team Fortress Classic overall, however, is a fun game to play, and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is a very good action game and to play in short bursts

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

[b] REVIEW SOURCES: [/b]
[list]
[*] None
Amplios servidores, funciona bien en computadores no tan actualizados
Very unbalanced, but also a good game. I rate 9/10.

Great game, could use some more players, but there seems to always be at least one populated server to join. But if you are used to TF2 then you should prepare yourself for the grenades as they are an important part of the game play.
Really fun once you get over the initial confusion caused by all the explosions. I recommend you play Half-Life first to get a grip on the controls

Just a really fun and quick shooter, can get really laggy but when it's good it's good, my only gripe other than that would probably be balancing of the characters although that might just be because I suck at using some characters more than others but I feel like certain characters are much better than others, but yeah other than that pretty fun shooter if you're just looking to kill some time! 

Although TF2 is pretty great too and is more balanced... AND IT'S FREE! So the only REAL reason to play this game is if you're interested in what the series's past games were like so uhh, yeh... issa good game.

yep

I have spent quite some time playing this game and I gotta tell you, it's awesome. To this day there are still people playing, and anybody at any skill levels can play. First things first, the characters. There is a incredibly large amount options to play as, from a Medic, to a Spy, to a Heavy Weapons Guy, to a Pyro. Not only that, but each of them have their own weapons and abilities. Such as healing others, faking their death, and so on. This game has a lot of content, especially for a game made in the 1990's packaged with Half-Life. So if your into online multiplayer first person shooters with different modes and characters, than you can't go wrong getting a copy of Team Fortress Classic.
Still really fun today! though, the community has taken over with modded servers, you can still have a blast!

I rate this game in 8/10;

It contains the first version of probably the most iconic characters in the history of the online fps.
Despite starting as a half-life mod, the gameplay is just incredible  with detailed characteristics to each class that u need to pratice for many hours to get good at. That can be one of the explanation to the fact that many people had been leaving the game from its start. Since you start understanding how to act as a certain class, playing this game will be one of the best experiences on and old fps.

Cons:
- Servers with low people
- High ping in some of them
- Unbalanced habilities in some classes, still if you know how to counter them ur good.

Conclusion:
I appreciate that there are still people playing this excelent game that inspired many others

Awesome game.

If you like TF2 you'll definitely like this. There's also some interesting unique mechanics that haven't made it through the transition into TF2. I feel like most people looking to buy this are familiar with that game. Don't think of this as just TF2 with less players and worse graphics, there are a ton of little aspects that make it unique.

 I'd definitely recommend checking this game out during the next steam sale when it's a dollar or so. Also, I'd love to see more players enjoying and making content for this game as there's not many people active anymore

Primeiramente, o jogo é bom! Porém, infelizmente não posso recomendá-lo e direi o porquê.
Basicamente é Half-Life 1 Deathmatch com algumas classes que se diferenciam pelas armas. O jogo não possui nenhum modo single player, ou que você possa jogar contra bots, basicamente você precisa achar um server ou criar algum com seus amigos. 
O maior problema é que o game está praticamente "morto", se você é brasileiro como eu e quer jogar, sinto-lhe informar que não achará server com menos de 150 de ping. Isso atrapalha bastante para um game FPS competitivo. 
Apesar de ser bom game que dê para se divertir, não posso recomendar para alguém algo que não funciona mais. Caso você queira algo semelhante, aconselho que jogue o modo multiplayer do Half-Life 1 que possui uma comunidade bem mais ativa e é praticamente a mesma coisa, ou caso queira mesmo essas diferenciações das classes, jogue o Team Fortress 2.
Eu realmente me decepcionei com o game, pois joguei ele no passado, e estava esperando que hoje em dia funcionasse tão bem quanto antes.

this game was the reason team fortress 2 exist, it was alot of fun
the fun classes were scout and heavy,
the maps are fun

try switching to wide screen and shit is fucked
the way to get true wide screen if you go to properties
then launch options
and add the commands -w 1024 -h 768 -stretchaspect
the graphics are shit but that is the charm since it's from 1999, everytime i see the graphic, i always feel like im back in the 1990 playing doom or quake
i give it a 9.5/10 classic masterpiece
